definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: Tom disappeared and we never heard of him.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆不知去向了，我們再未聽見他的消息。

sentences.english: If I were you, I would explain to Harry what happened.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是你，我會去向哈利解釋事情的經過。

sentences.english: But Kinney says discussing the dog’s future (or lack thereof) was still unsettling.
sentences.chinese: 但金妮說討論這隻狗的未來去向，仍是前途未卜。

sentences.english: The victim beefed and went to the police.
sentences.chinese: 受害人去向警方告發了。

sentences.english: You have to account to the accountant tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 你明天得去向會計報賬。

sentences.english: A second candidate for the extractive-elite category is the public sector.
sentences.chinese: 另外一個可供掠奪性精英選擇的去向就是公共部門。

sentences.english: What in the name of God is going on there?
sentences.chinese: 我們憑藉着上帝的名義將要去向何處？

sentences.english: When they could see again, Chiang was gone.
sentences.chinese: 大家再睜眼看時，江已經不知去向了。

sentences.english: But the third-worst spot for highway congestion, Chicago's CircleInterchange, is going nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 但名列第三位擁堵的芝加哥環路交口卻還不知去向。

sentences.english: After a serious thought, Han Jie decides to see Han Xing to offer his apology.
sentences.chinese: 經過一番思考，漢傑想通了，他決定去向漢星道歉。

sentences.english: And the little also told her husband where is Malena now.
sentences.chinese: 最後也是這個小男孩告訴她老公馬蓮娜的去向。

sentences.english: The police asked Ms. Heim if they knew Mr. Snowden's whereabouts. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 警察曾詢問Heim女士是否知道史諾頓的去向。

sentences.english: Google Flights also shows airfares on a map to help you decide where to go.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌航班還能在地圖上顯示票價，幫您決定去向。

sentences.english: A student say goodbye to his master before he leave Beijing for taking a post in another place.
sentences.chinese: 一個學生在離京到外地赴任之前，去向他的老師告別。

sentences.english: Silicic acid had no effect on soil pH, ammonium accumulation and the rate of N mineralization.
sentences.chinese: 兩種硅肥對施入土壤中氮的去向均無明顯影響。

sentences.english: My father called the bank to stop payment on the check.
sentences.chinese: 我父親打電話到銀去向付那張支票。

definition: to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
to learn of (an event)/to hear about (sth)
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
to find out/to know/to learn about
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
